sub_title: Education Pioneer I Obama Leader Europe I Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science
summary:
I am a driven community manager and social entrepreneur with a focus on education, innovation and diversity. In 2022, I was selected by the Obama Foundation as one of the 35 Obama Leaders for Europe in 2022. In 2018, I was selected by the Dutch Financial Times in their Top 50 most promising talents. In both 2015 and 2016, I was selected into the Top 100 Best Young Professionals in the Netherlands (spot 18 and 17, Memory Group Magazine). 

After having finished my Social Innovation Fellowship at the U.S. State Department as one of the first seven Europeans, I lead the Dutch cohort of 34 Global Shapers for the World Economic Forum. From May 2017 until September 2022, I worked with the city councils, universities and universities of applied sciences of the twenty biggest Dutch cities to innovate higher education on behalf of the Dutch government and all formal representative parties of higher education. As of October 2022, I started as a senior policy officer at the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, with the task of connecting organizations and movements on a national level when it comes to education innovation in Dutch higher education. In April 2023 I was asked to lead the Taskforce on internationalization and international student streams, one of the main issues our Minister of Education faces. In 2012, I founded my own social platform AMS Connected, through which my team and I connected 4.000 Amsterdam locals and expats to each other and their local communities by hosting over 150 events per year. I handed over the lead for this platform in 2017, and still consult on the way forward for the team.

I have a background in Political Science (MSc summa cum laude at the University of Amsterdam) and Communication- and Information Sciences (MA summa cum laude at VU University Amsterdam), with a Minor in Military Science (at the Royal Military Academy).

treasury_media.title: Rowinda Appelman doet mee aan Leaders-programma Obama Foundation
treasury_media.description: Programmamanager Rowinda Appelman is geselecteerd voor het leiderschapsprogramma van de Obama Foundation. Zij krijgt de kans een uitdagend virtueel programma van 6 maanden te volgen, waarin leiderschapsontwikkeling en maatschappelijke betrokkenheid. Lees meer via de link.

treasury_media.title: 4 jaar City Deal Kennis Maken: ‘Tijd voor een nieuwe fase’ - interview met Rowinda Appelman
treasury_media.description: In 2017 trapte de City Deal Kennis Maken af. Nu gaat de City Deal een nieuwe fase in, met een nieuwe financiële regeling. Programmamanager Rowinda Appelman kijkt terug op vier jaar City Deal en vertelt meer over de nieuwe koers. ‘We gaan het nu echt op een andere manier doen.’

treasury_media.title: Projectleider Rowinda Appelman in top 50 talentenspecial FD
NATO Summit Wales: Introducing Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen
treasury_media.description: Introduction of NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen at the NATO Summit, by Rowinda Appelman - President of the Youth Atlantic Treaty Association. Mr Rasmussen addressed the Future Leaders Summit, part of the Wales Summit at Celtic Manor. Date: 04 September 2014.

treasury_media.title: ‘De campusbubbel doorbroken’- City Deal Kennis Maken verbindt groepen in de stad
treasury_media.description: Interview on my latest government project, the City Deal on Education

treasury_media.title: Social Innovation Fellow U.S. State Deparment: Project Description
treasury_media.description: With the support of Meridian Social Innovation Fellowship, Rowinda created ABN: Actief Beter Nederlands. ABN establishes social, cultural, and community service programs for expats in Amsterdam, organizing an existing network of over 5,000 potential participants. By expanding the audience and scope of the Amsterdam Language Café program, a monthly event that brings together the city’s international community, ABN will provide language training to immigrant children as well on a weekly basis.

treasury_media.title: Spot 17 on the Top 100 Best Young Professionals of the Netherlands 2016
treasury_media.description: Annual list made by the Memory Group, responsible for all the national career events, conferences and it owns numerous talent recruitment agencies.

profile_positions.title: Coördinator taskforce instroom internationale studenten

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Education, Culture and Science
profile_positions.description: Connecting organizations and movements on a national level when it comes to education innovation in the Dutch higher education system.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer I Connecting organizations and movements around education innovation

profile_positions.description:
I have been selected by the Obama Foundation as an Obama Leader for #Europe for 2022, alongside 35 other incredible people. 

The 2022 cohort represents 24 countries across the region, and I am proud to be this year's Dutch representative. The six month program trains emerging leaders in senior leadership development and civic engagement, to help build their skills and scale their work across public, private, and nonprofit sectors. All participants have proven their focus on advancing the common good. I will focus my participation in the program on advancing the societal impact of higher education within cities and regions, while learning how to strengthen a national movement around this.
profile_positions.title: Obama Leader Europe

profile_positions.description:
The Deltapremie aims to increase the visibility and impact of applied research. In addition, it aims to transition researchers into ambassadors for applied research. The Deltapremie is awarded every 2 years to 2 researchers, each receiving EUR 500,000. All presidents of the executive board of Dutch universities of applied sciences can nominate one candidate per edition.

De Deltapremie heeft als doel om de zichtbaarheid en de doorwerking van praktijkgericht onderzoek te vergroten. Daarnaast stimuleert de premie dat lectoren zich ontwikkelen tot ambassadeurs van het praktijkgericht onderzoek. De Deltapremie wordt elke 2 jaar uitgereikt aan 2 lectoren. De premie bedraagt 500.000 euro. Voorzitters college van bestuur van hogescholen kunnen per editie een voordracht doen.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead Deltapremie

profile_positions.description:
The City Deal "Kennis Maken" aims to innovate higher education in the Netherlands, while at the same time work towards solutions for societal issues. The program focuses on the biggest 20 cities of the country, and is set up by the Ministry of Education and all formal representative parties for Dutch higher education. The program focuses on forming stronger communicative and collaborative ties between city councils, universities, universities of applied sciences and local organizations, while on the other hand working intensively with researchers, professors and students towards usage of the city as a rich learning environment with an emphasis on societal change, creating strong civic universities and interconnected knowledge cities.

Responsible for the overall set up, coordination and implementation of the City Deal "Kennis Maken" within the 20 biggest Dutch cities. Next to that responsible for the national network, the overall financing structure, the strategic cooperation with the Minister of Education and all involved executives of city councils, universities and universities of applied sciences. Also responsible for all City Deal events, research done on behalf of the City Deal and the knowledge exchange on a national level.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager City Deal Kennis Maken

profile_positions.description:
I was one of the 34 Dutch Global Shapers, and in 2016-2017 lead the Dutch cohort of Shapers.

The Global Shapers Community is one of the multi-stakeholder communities at the World Economic Forum. After a thorough selection process, Global Shapers are selected on the basis of their achievements, leadership potential, and commitment to make a difference. My projects as a Global Shaper focus on Active Citizenship and Intercultural Understanding. In 2015, I was responsible for all recruitment activities for the Dutch Hub.  In June 2016, I became the Curator of our Hub.
profile_positions.title: Global Shaper

profile_positions.description:
As Kwartiermaker / Pioneer, I will build and activate a nationwide network to innovate education in lower schools around the Netherlands. 

Through IMC Weekendschool and with the Ministry of Education, the school system and the corporate world, I will set up the necessary networks for implementation of the highly successful concept "IMC Basis" in 16 Dutch cities over the next 2 years. It will be my core task to build a diverse and committed long term network in each of the cities, while also being responsible for marketing, partnerships, acquisition and relationship management with all stakeholders at a national level.
profile_positions.title: Kwartiermaker IMC Basis

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for building and expanding communities, as well as the organization and hosting of
networking events, volunteer opportunities and social events for expatriates and locals in Amsterdam. Main goal: to connect people to one another and to their local community. 

Most recent project: establishment of the community AMS Connected, in April 2014. Solely
responsible for growing it to more than 1.900+ members within one year.

- Amount of visitors per organized event: 25-800. Amount of organized events: 122 in 2015; 130 in 2016, 120 in 2017.
- Total network of clients: 7.790 individuals. Amount of organizers on my team: 08.
- Initiator of new market ideas, e.g. Rowin’s Brunch Club, the first monthly brunch concept for expats in Amsterdam (see below).
- Access to a large self-built network of venues. charities and organizations in Amsterdam and nearby cities.
- Final responsibility for sponsorships, recruitment, social media campaigns and communication.
profile_positions.title: Social Entrepreneur & Community Manager

profile_positions.description: Advising the United States Embassy in The Hague on how to engage youth in the Netherlands when it comes to outreach, program activities, usage of social media and the selection of candidates for fellowships and studies in the United States.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Youth Council

profile_positions.description:
One of the 07 selected candidates for the inaugural Fellowship program of Meridian International Center - in cooperation with the U.S. State Department - focusing on Social Innovation. 

During my Fellowship, I will help strengthen the international community in Amsterdam by providing language training and networking. This will be done through the Amsterdam Language Cafe and charity Actief Beter Nederlands (ABN), which I both run with my business partner Koen Gijzel. The Amsterdam Language Cafe brings together over 250 people on the first Friday of the month, and all proceeds of the night go to ABN, to help language learning for children in Amsterdam Nieuw-West.
profile_positions.title: Social Innovation Fellow

profile_positions.description:
As a six month project, I will innovate and strengthen the alumni network of IMC Weekendschool, and set up and coordinate all national events, masterclasses, in-house days with corporations and special projects (e.g. a summer school and national sports day). I will also help restructure the overall year plans of the department. 

The 1.500 children and young adults from underprivileged neighborhoods in the Netherlands have each received supplementary education from the age of 10 to 14. There are two alumni groups:  14-18 years old, and 18+. Each group has their own events and network structures.
profile_positions.title: National Coordinator Alumni Network

volunteer_experiences.description:
After having been responsible for the overall management of Weekend Academie Westerpark, I remained involved within the company as a guest lecturer. 

Responsible for a Master class every other week, to students aged 10-15 years. Classes touched upon personal expertise, e.g. Communication, International Relations, Education and Media Training.
Personal tasks: organizing conferences, seminars, panel discussions and lectures for specific target groups, with audiences ranging between 15 and 110 people.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Global Leadership Program, Group A`09
volunteer_experiences.description: Annual program focused on developing leadership and cultural competency, by traveling through 3 continents with 90 people from 22 countries. The program includes leadership workshops, guest lectures, debates, training sessions and community service projects (189 hours completed personally) in every city visited (20 in total).
